dct_title_s: Bowles's new four-sheet map of the world on Mercator's projection
dct_alternative_sm: Bowles's new four-sheet map of the world on Mercator's projection : exhibiting the several quarters of the globe divided into their respective empires, kingdoms, states, &c., agreeable to the latest treaties and political regulations now existing; together with all the new discoveries and most interesting tracks of those eminent circumnavigators, Cook, Byron, Bougainville, Perouse, Vancouver &c.
dct_description_sm: 1 map : hand col., dissected and mounted on canvas ; 101 x 117 cm., folded in slipcase 21 x 14 cm.
Shows routes and years of 10 voyages.
Decorative title cartouche depicting voyaging supplies, a ship, and two explorers holding a map and a sextant.
Includes notes on finding the distance betwixt two places.
Top border shows hours, east from London.
dcat_keyword_sm: World maps Early works to 1800 Facsimiles.
dct_rights_sm: This map is in the public domain.
dct_rightsHolder_sm: Please attribute access and use of this digitized map to the Stephen S. Clark Library, University of Michigan Library. https://www.lib.umich.edu/about-us/policies/copyright-policy
